abstract.text: An interaction that provides text selection gestures and UI to custom text views.

code: // Create a selection interaction for non-editable content.
// Assign `textInput` to your view that implements the `UITextInput` protocol
// to get more control over the selection behavior and the text input system.

inlineContent.text: If your custom text view supports editable and non-editable text, create two interactions — one for each mode — and add the interaction that matches the state of text to the view while removing the other interaction.
If your app provides other gestures in the same view hierarchy, you can use the
method to set up failure requirements between your app’s gestures and the text interaction gestures listed in the

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
Creates a dependency relationship between the gesture recognizer and another gesture recognizer when the objects are created.
The protocol that an interaction implements to access the view that owns it.
An object that displays an editable text area in your interface.
A set of methods for interacting with the text input system and enabling features in documents.
An interaction that provides text selection gestures and UI to custom text views.
The object that receives events from the text interaction.
The list of gestures that the text interaction adds to the view hierarchy.
Creates a text interaction with the specified mode.
The object that interacts with the text input system.
The mode of the text interaction.
An interface that an object implements to receive information about text interaction events.
Modes that determine the selection behaviors that a text interaction provides.
A mode indicating that the text interaction should provide selection behaviors for editable text.
A mode indicating that the text interaction should provide selection behaviors for non-editable, read-only text.
A scrollable, multiline text region.
Incorporate the system text-selection experience into your custom text UI in UIKit.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Adopting system selection UI in custom text views

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
